medical_history.chief_complaint: Swelling of the legs and skin changes.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Approximately 2 years earlier, the patient was admitted to another hospital due to painful swelling of the left leg, with subsequent episodes of increasing swelling and skin changes. Initial management involved anticoagulation and the discontinuation of oral contraceptives, but swelling persisted and worsened over time.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Chronic kidney disease caused by congenital ureteral reflux (not requiring dialysis), previous episodes of thrombosis, and a neobladder constructed 20 years prior.
medical_history.family_history: Biologic mother died of vulvar carcinoma in her 50s; a biologic uncle died of colon cancer; no known family history of hematologic, renal, or rheumatic diseases.
medical_history.social_history: Lives with her husband and son, works in an office, drinks alcohol rarely, does not smoke, allergic to penicillin, sulfa, nitrofurantoin, and vancomycin.
